@description.body:

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
This event is fired after a list item was added to the list. The
{@link qx.event.type.Data#getData} method of the event returns the
added item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
This event is fired after a list item has been removed from the list.
The {@link qx.event.type.Data#getData} method of the event returns the
removed item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Fired on every modification of the selection which also means that the
value has been modified.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fires after the selection was modified

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Spacing between the items

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Controls whether the inline-find feature is activated or not

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The name of the list. Mainly used for serialization proposes.

@description.name: @description
@description
@description.body: Enable drag selection (multi selection of items through dragging the mouse in pressed states). Only possible for the selection modes multi and additive

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Enable quick selection mode, where no tap is needed to change the selection. Only possible for the modes single and one.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: interface implementation

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} The configured widget for the given cell.
@return.description: The configured widget for the given cell.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: interface implementation

@param.name: @param
@param.body: widget {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} The cell widget to pool.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the stringified value of the list. This is a comma
separated string with all the values (or labels as fallback).

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Applied new selection from a comma separated list of values (labels
as fallback) of the list items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the children list

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{LayoutItem[]} The children array (Arrays are
reference types, please do not modify them in-place)
@return.description:
The children array (Arrays are
reference types, please do not modify them in-place)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget contains children.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Returns true when the widget has children.
@return.description: Returns true when the widget has children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Adds a new child widget.

The supported keys of the layout options map depend on the layout manager
used to position the widget. The options are documented in the class
documentation of each layout manager {@link qx.ui.layout}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove the given child item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove all children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the index position of the given item if it is a child item. Otherwise it returns -1. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {LayoutItem} the item to query for

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The index position or -1 when the given item is no child of this layout.
@return.description: The index position or -1 when the given item is no child of this layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Add a child at the specified index

This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
(e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index, at which the item will be inserted
@param.description: Index, at which the item will be inserted

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Add a item before another already inserted item

This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
(e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: before {LayoutItem} item before the new item will be inserted.
@param.description: item before the new item will be inserted.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Add a item after another already inserted item

This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
(e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: after {LayoutItem} item, after which the new item will be inserted
@param.description: item, after which the new item will be inserted

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Remove the item at the specified index.

This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
(e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index of the item to remove.
@param.description: Index of the item to remove.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Selects all items of the managed object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Selects the given item. Replaces current selection
completely with the new item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Detects whether the given item is currently selected.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Adds the given item to the existing selection.

Use {@link #selectItem} instead if you want to replace
the current selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Removes the given item from the selection.

Use {@link #clearSelection} when you want to clear
the whole selection at once.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Selects an item range between two given items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Clears the whole selection at once.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Replaces current selection with the given items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the selected item. This method does only work in single selection mode.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the selected item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array of currently selected items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns an array of currently selected items sorted
by their index in the container.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the selection is empty

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the last selection context. One of tap, quick, drag or key or null.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns all elements which are selectable.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply
